title: Cowboy Potatoes
ingredients: 4 to 5 pounds small red potatoes, scrubbed and cut into wedges
instructions: Coat the potato wedges with the melted butter and toss them with the onion and garlic.  Sprinkle them generously with salt, pepper, and oregano and place them in a baking dish that will hold everything.  Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the oven for 1 hour, opening the oven occasionally to give the baking dish a, “good shake”.  After 1 hour, remove the foil and continue cooking for another 30 minutes to give the potatoes a nice “color”.
remarks: This is probably our [Perini Ranch Steakhouse] most popular side dish … because steak and potatoes are just standard for this part of the world.  This [dish] is easy because you don’t have to peel the potatoes, and the skin adds to the flavor and the color. Yield:  Serves 8 to 10. Source:   Cowboy Cooking by Tom Perini with Paschal Fowlkes, published by Time/Life Books, , © 2000 Tom Perini. Cowboy potatoes
